chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:46 AM Defendant Jonathan M Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Jonathan M Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense needs 60 days to review and receive discovery.

by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.
Denying Defense Motion for Access to Personal Property.
Regarding Defendant's Access to Personal Property.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan M Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason S Dreifuss in court for Jonathan M Martinez. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Motion hearing concerning personal property.
Defense states that there are drawings, photos, and personal effects of defendant's received in the jail and were taken by jail staff and not returned to him.  Requesting the Court direct an order to the jail returning these items to him.
Defense does not cite legal authority.
State obj.
BTC: Order requiring Sheriff's department to hold items for defendant and not to destroy them.  Defense to file an order.
Defense is working yet to obtain digital discovery and working with law enforcement as well as ADA.  Requests a further status hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
